bug.short_desc: mount of Samba share to local directory fails with return code -113
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
unable to mount samba share
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): 4.4.3-1.fc24
How reproducible: 100%
Steps to Reproduce: 1. use command line to attempt to mount samba share 2. 3.
Actual results:
mount fails with return code -113, decodes as problem writing or locking mtab
Expected results:
local dir mounts samba share
Additional info:
server is f23. It works, android and windows clients will connect
corresponding fstab line is:
# # hand written # //192.168.001.011/hcmeyer /home/hcmeyer/Samba cifs noauto,users 0 0
mount.cifs had s bit set, using chmod

Yes. It fixes the issue.
Really dumb. I cannot remember what, but I had something fail because numbers with leading zeros were interpreted as octal. The "011" would become a 9. But I do not get an "unable to find address" message.
Thank you.

*********** MASS BUG UPDATE **************
We apologize for the inconvenience. There is a large number of bugs to go through and several of them have gone stale. Due to this, we are doing a mass bug update across all of the Fedora 24 kernel bugs.
Fedora 24 has now been rebased to 4.7.4-200.fc24. Please test this kernel update (or newer) and let us know if you issue has been resolved or if it is still present with the newer kernel.
If you have moved on to Fedora 25, and are still experiencing this issue, please change the version to Fedora 25.
If you experience different issues, please open a new bug report for those.
Workaround works, I think the original parsing problem has been fixed. Please close.
